de.szut.dqi12.cheftrainer.server.databasecommunication

Class TransfermarketManagement

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.szut.dqi12.cheftrainer.server.databasecommunication.TransfermarketManagement

  • public class TransfermarketManagement
extends java.lang.Object
    The TransfermarketManagement is used to send queries according or the transfermarket, the transactions and offers to the database and workup the results.
    Author:
    Alexander Brennecke

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TransfermarketManagement(SQLConnection sqlCon)
      Constructor

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addTransaction(Transaction tr)
      This function adds a new Transaction to the database.
      void deletePlayerFromExchangeMarket(int playerSportalID, int communityID)
      This function creates a query, which will delete the given Player from the exchange market of the given Community.
      void deleteTransaction(int playerSportalID, int communityID, int managerID)
      This function should be called to delete the offer of one Manager to one Player in one Community
      void deleteTransactions(int playerSportalID, int communityID)
      This function should be called to delete all Transactions for one Player.
      void doTransactions()
      This function checks, if there is a Transaction in one of the Communitys.
      void putPlayerOnExchangeMarket(Player p, int communityID, int ownerID)
      This function sets the given Player on the exchange market of the given Community
      void transferPlayer(Transaction t)
      The Player will be "transfered" which means, that the offer will be subtracted at the buyer and added at the last owner.

        public TransfermarketManagement(SQLConnection sqlCon)
        Constructor

        sqlCon - active SQL Connection

    • Method Detail

      • putPlayerOnExchangeMarket

        public void putPlayerOnExchangeMarket(Player p,
                                      int communityID,
                                      int ownerID)
        This function sets the given Player on the exchange market of the given Community
        Parameters:
        p - the Player object, with at least the sportalID and the worth set
        communityID - the ID of the Community, in which the owner plays
        ownerID - the ID of the owner (the Manager ID)

      • addTransaction

        public boolean addTransaction(Transaction tr)
        This function adds a new Transaction to the database.
        Parameters:
        tr - a Transaction object, where each parameter is set.

      • doTransactions

        public void doTransactions()
        This function checks, if there is a Transaction in one of the Communitys.

      • transferPlayer

        public void transferPlayer(Transaction t)
        The Player will be "transfered" which means, that the offer will be subtracted at the buyer and added at the last owner. Last but not least the buyer will be the new owner of the Player.
        Parameters:
        t -

      • deletePlayerFromExchangeMarket

        public void deletePlayerFromExchangeMarket(int playerSportalID,
                                           int communityID)
                                    throws java.sql.SQLException
        This function creates a query, which will delete the given Player from the exchange market of the given Community.
        Parameters:
        playerSportalID - the sportal ID of the Player, that should be removed
        communityID - the Community ID of the Community, where the Player should be removed from the Market.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • deleteTransactions

        public void deleteTransactions(int playerSportalID,
                               int communityID)
                        throws java.sql.SQLException
        This function should be called to delete all Transactions for one Player.
        Parameters:
        playerSportalID - the sportal ID of the Player,
        communityID - the ID of the Community
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • deleteTransaction

        public void deleteTransaction(int playerSportalID,
                              int communityID,
                              int managerID)
                       throws java.sql.SQLException
        This function should be called to delete the offer of one Manager to one Player in one Community
        Parameters:
        playerSportalID - the sportal ID of the Player
        communityID - the Community ID
        managerID - the ID of the Manager
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
